intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium parvulifrons, commonly known as the small-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. It has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and its yellow flowers bloom in clusters. Hieracium parvulifrons is often found in open habitats and is relatively hardy, though it can be sensitive to environmental changes.
